Package controller.java

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
controller.java.Controller
public class Controller extends Object
Class Controller This is the Controller that will contact the database and send information to the view This will be the point of contact between the DAOs
Author:
Name: Romain Clemencon, Student Number: R00193006, Group: SDH2C

      public Controller()

  • Method Details

    • addPerson

      public boolean addPerson​(List<Object> personInfo)
      Add a Person to the database A Person will be created using the personInfo, a Name will also be added to the database with JPA Hibernate OnetoOne relationship
      Parameters:
      personInfo - List of Objects (String and int), each carrying the attributes for a Person object
      Returns:
      false if a person is already in the database with that ID / true if successful

    • loadPerson

      public List<model.java.Person> loadPerson()
      Load all the Persons from the database onto a list
      Returns:
      a List of Person (all the person in the db)

    • updatePerson

      public void updatePerson​(List<Object> personInfo)
      Update a Person in the database
      Parameters:
      personInfo - List of Objects (String and int), each carrying the attributes for a Person object Like in addPerson, we create a new Person object. Then we update the whole object instead of checking what was modified.

    • deletePerson

      public void deletePerson​(int id)
      Delete a Person by ID This is very simple, the person will be found in the database using the ID then will be removed.
      Parameters:
      id - ID (int) of a Person

    • findPerson

      public model.java.Person findPerson​(int id)
      Find and retrieve a Person by ID The Person will be retrieved by their Unique ID, then returned.
      Parameters:
      id - ID of a Person to find in the database
      Returns:
      the Person whom ID was passed as parameter

    • addContact

      public void addContact​(model.java.Contact contact)
      Add a Contact by contact object Here we directly supply a Contact object carrying two person ID and a date and time. The contact unique ID is automatically generated by the SQL database as it is setup with AUTO_INCREMENT.
      Parameters:
      contact - Contact object passed as parameter

    • loadContact

      public List<model.java.Contact> loadContact()
      Load all the Contacts from the database onto a list Exactly similar to the Load Person method.
      Returns:
      List of Contact, with all the Contacts in the database

    • deleteContact

      public void deleteContact​(int id)
      Delete a Contact from the database User don't have a direct access to the Unique ID of a Contact generated by the database. But, by clicking on the table with Contacts. The unique ID will be retrieved from the row and passed into this method. Allowing a user to delete a Contact.
      Parameters:
      id - Unique identifier of the Contact

    • save

      public void save()
      Save the Name, Person and Contact table to their own serialized file This method call the three DAOs to load the Objects into Lists and Serialize those lists into a file.
